graph_manager module

class graph_manager.GraphManager(tk_root: Widget)[source]

Bases: object

Class to manage the graph.

! This class should not expose private variables such as fig, axes or canvas with getters. It should create an abstraction layer over them to limit and control the usage of internal and private features. Ex: we abstract canvas re-drawing with build() and click-handling with bind(). !

add_candidate(candidate: Candidate) → bool[source]

Adds the candidate to the graph (point and annotation), without building it. Calling build() is necessary to see the updated changes.

add_candidate_approbation_circles(approval_radius: int)[source]

Adds the approval circles around candidates on the graph. Voters inside a candidate’s circle are approving of them.

Parameters:

approval_radius – Radius of the approval circle

add_voter(voter: Voter) → bool[source]

Adds the voter to the graph (point and annotation), without building it. Calling build() is necessary to see the updated changes.

add_voter_closeness_circles(closeness_radius: int)[source]

Adds the closeness circles around voters on the graph.

Parameters:

approval_radius – Radius of the closeness circle

bind(event: str, callable: Callable)[source]

Bind an event to a callable.

build()[source]

Toggles the visibility of the annotations of all voters based on the value of __toggle_state. Builds the updated graph by calling canvas.draw().

clear_candidate_approbation_circles()[source]

Clears the approval circles around candidates on the graph.

clear_candidates()[source]

Clears all the candidates from the graph, without building it. Calling build() is necessary to see the updated changes.

clear_voter_closeness_circles()[source]

Clears the closeness circles around voters on the graph.

clear_voters()[source]

Clears all the voters from the graph, without building it. Calling build() is necessary to see the updated changes.

edit_candidate_at(index: int, candidate: Candidate)[source]

Edits the candidate at a given index on the graph, without building it. Calling build() is necessary to see the updated changes.

Parameters:

  • index – index of the desired candidate

  • candidate – new candidate data

edit_voter_at(index: int, voter: Voter)[source]

Edits the voter at a given index on the graph, without building it. Calling build() is necessary to see the updated changes.

Parameters:

  • index – index of the desired voter

  • voter – new voter data

get_diagonal()[source]

Return the diagonal size of the graph.

get_tk_widget() → Canvas[source]

Return the Tk widget used to implement FigureCanvasTkAgg.

! This method exposes the Tk widget, but I believe this is the only instance where it’s fine because it’s necessary !

get_toggle_state() → bool[source]

Return the boolean value of toggle_state :return: True if __toggle_state == True, False otherwise

set_toggle_state(value: bool)[source]

Sets the boolean value of toggle_state to that of value
